comment.author: 53441589@N08
comment._content: Luv this shot because of the patched jeans.  I too was a "hitchiker" in the south west in 1972, and had very similar patched jeans.  (only had one pair and no money to buy new ones, which were not cool anyways, new ones that is).  Thousands of us were out on the highway during this period.   There would be three people at every intersection sometimes.    That was almost 40 years ago, things were alot slower and safer then in USA, very little highway traffic, the Interstate system was in its infancy.   I was "on the road" for nearly 6 months then, changed my life for the good but would not recomment hitchiking nowadays to a young 20 something.

comment.author: 35740357@N03
comment._content:
Dear Suzy Douce 814U:

Glad you like the photo of Tripper and his master. Yes, the patched jeans seem to say it all. This is arguably  the most popular image from the DOCUMERICA collection, taken by photographer Charles O'Rear while on assignment for the EPA in Southern California. O'Rear still works in photography, and has published a number of photo studies of the Napa Valley wine country. (http://charlesorear.photoshelter.com/)

Jerry (U.S. National Archives)

comment.author: 7836195@N07
comment._content: Crazy good.

comment.author: 24506419@N08
comment._content:
Awesome historical shot.
Do we know who the person is?
R.I.P. Tripper

comment.author: 35740357@N03
comment._content:
itsAngelo:

We know from photographer Charles O'Rear that he never learned the hitchhiker's name. He only learned Tripper's name. This is arguably the most popular DOCUMERICA image in the collection.

Jerry (U.S. National Archives)

comment.author: 10249917@N00
comment._content: Awesome, evocative picture. He's cute! I would totally have dated him if I wasn't only 4 months old at the time the picture was taken! Amazing to think that he'd be in his late Fifties/ early Sixties now...

comment.author: 35740357@N03
comment._content:
Hi, wirrn!
Glad you like the photo. It's one of our favorites here at National Archives. I spoke with the photographer Charles O'Rear about this guy and he says he never learned the hitchhiker's name, unfortunately. Can't beat those groovy threads!

Jerry (U.S. National Archives)
